Posts.Content: Jul 17, 2009 02:58AM Times3 wrote: In this disease, Minimal is a good scenerio when it comes to progression. Don't ever hate to ask! You are always the one to help others! I know, I am one of them. It is your turn! I think that you and your doctors will have a great discussion on your care options, and you will come out of there knowing exactly what is best for you!  I would love to be a fly on the wall with all of the knowledge that will be in the room, you are always on top of everything! You amaze and inspire me! I need you feeling better so we can meet in Louisville, We have some ghosts waitin' for us!
Posts.Title: Progression on scans - need advice LuAnnH mom2acat

Posts.Content: Times3 wrote: I just got off a 6 week Chemo break and during which time, I elected to have my Ovaries removed because of being ER+. I had a few problems healing so the doc ordered a CT scan. Well, went to see the Onc Fri, and he gave me another 6 week break but wants me to have my gallbladder removed because I have gallstones and a thick walled gallbladder with fluid, he found by looking at the CT scan report. My mom researched it and she said that it could cause diarrea constantly (like I dont have that free flowing one minute and stopped up the next already) I know that it will be another lapro surgery but have any of you ladies had this done? I keep telling my family that if they want to take things out of me that I wish they would take things that weigh more than these tiny organs, but they tell me I need the heavy ones?!?  Edited to say that I already had a partial Hyst about 5 years ago for Endometreosis. Still baffles me why the Onc didn't suggest having them removed then.  I already had BC once by then. Kendra Dx 12/2008, IDC, 1cm, Stage IV, Grade 2, 0/1 nodes, mets, ER+/PR+, HER2- Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Chemo Break and Another Surgery Times3 VerJee

Posts.Content: Apr 17, 2009 07:46PM Times3 wrote: Thanks everyone. Onc only said what the CT scan stated, shows improvement.  I am set up for another PET scan next month.  We were going to check the tumor markers and go through this surgery and recover before we make the new plan. On that note, I called the Onc today to get the results of the TMs and low and behold, they didn't run the test! This is the second time! So now, I have to go in Monday after my appointment with the General Surgeon to schedule my surgery, to give them more blood!  All I know is that they better not even charge me for the Labs! What is it about me? First not giving me my woosy meds before surgeries and then not getting my TMs done?  Sorry to vent, today my nerves have just been shot, Xanax hasn't even helped! Oh well, tomorrow will be a better day!
Posts.Title: Chemo Break and Another Surgery Times3 VerJee

Posts.Content: Jul 15, 2009 12:33PM Times3 wrote: She is absolutely beautiful, so is your daugther! Look at all that hair, my daughter didn't even get her first haircut till she was three! Where is the picture of Grandma and baby?
Posts.Title: Heather Palmerton's new grand daughter pictures Fitztwins virginiamom

Posts.Content: Mar 18, 2009 03:59AM Times3 wrote: Amazing grace has to be the one that does it for me also! Garth Brooks "The Dance" is a close second. Kinda of strange song picks when you normally listen to Rock (hard and alternative). My music isn't the kind of music they play at weddings and funerals though. But it won't make you cry, unless you bang your head on something! lol
Posts.Title: What Song Makes You Go Over The Edge? KellyC cp418

Posts.Content: Jul 15, 2009 11:20AM - edited Jul 15, 2009 11:28AM by Times3 Clean here too. I had one breast removed 7 1/2 years ago and a reccurance to the same side where the breast used to be 3 years ago, but never had it in the other.  When they found mets last year in my liver, my breast was clear. Edited to add...Now I am NED and hope to stay that way for a long time.
Posts.Title: How many of us have mets but clean breast vivo Roxanne1

Posts.Content: Mar 25, 2009 02:19AM Times3 wrote: I was Dxed with Liver mets in 11/08.  I had a bio when I was first dxed in 02 and another when I found a lump in 06. This time when I went in because I was having pain under my ribs and my numbers were out of whack, he told me it was in my liver and the game plan was 6 rounds of Abraxane/Avastin. I trust my Onc and never questioned his plan. I didn't know that receptors could even change between Dx's until I found this forum. Never had the desire to research because I found the lumps early and I could do my Chemo and it would go away, so I thought until the word mets. So I asked him about having my ovaries removed because I have always been ER+ and about getting a Bio done even after Chemo to make sure nothing has changed.  Onc agreed to both. The radiologist that did the CT directed Bio was surprised that I was even having it done because I had already had Chemo but I told him that I requested one.  He said that my Onc is one of the best in the Tri-state and would not have given me Chemo if he didn't already know what my receptors were, so how could he have known without a biopsy? I had bloodtests and Pet Scans only this go around, or was he basing it off of the first two were both ER+, or is he just that D___ good? With all that I have been through by my own request in the last week, maybe I should just go by what he says.  He seems to keep me out of more pain than I do!
Posts.Title: Biopsy / Standard of Care? Reneepals LuAnnH

Posts.Content: Mar 20, 2009 04:57PM - edited Mar 20, 2009 04:57PM by Times3 Kimvidito and mthomp2020, if I were you I would look for a new Onc. I love mine, he will sit and answer any questions that I have and he or one of his nurses will call with the results of all my test as soon as he receives them. There is no reason for your family to wait and worry about a scan or test until your next appointment.  If they don't call you, call them. The less stress you have the better! Happy birthday mthomp2020!
Posts.Title: Scanxiety time mthomp2020 Times3

Posts.Content: Jan 23, 2009 09:22PM - edited Jan 23, 2009 09:23PM by Times3 Watson...Can you send me one of those dolls?  I could use it! I understand about the men that make this disease all about them, I am living with one of them too.  I am the one that works 40 hours a week and carry the insurance for the whole family.  He has been laid off since the end of August (on our anniversery) and still collecting unemployment and working part time at an RC car shop/track.  Definately man-child.  Most of the time I feel like I am raising 3 kids instead of 2!  Any word on how Kimmytoo is doing?
Posts.Title: gripe - hubby not happy... kimmytoo pee

Posts.Content: Times3 wrote: I am just curious to find out how old all of you were when first being dx'ed with BC (I don't need to know the year, I hate math so I wouldn't try to figure out how old you are now anyway).  It just bothers me that they are still promoting waiting until you are 40 to get a mammo. I was 29 when I was first dx with BC, 34 with loc reoccurance and 36 with Mets to liver. Good thing I didn't wait till I was 40! My Onc suggests that my daughter get a mammo five years before I was dx'ed.  She is almost 18 now! Also, I don't know if I have the BRCA gene or not, we are gettng ready to start that process but it scares me to know that I could have passed this to my daughter. Kendra Dx 12/2008, IDC, 1cm, Stage IV, Grade 2, 0/1 nodes, mets, ER+/PR+, HER2- Log in to post a reply

Also, I don't know if I have the BRCA gene or not, we are gettng ready to start that process but it scares me to know that I could have passed this to my daughter. Kendra Dx 12/2008, IDC, 1cm, Stage IV, Grade 2, 0/1 nodes, mets, ER+/PR+, HER2- Log in to post a reply

Posts.Content: Mar 11, 2009 09:07PM Times3 wrote: I am sure that your kids are just as proud of you as you are of them.  You are an amazing woman and your kids achievements just prove it! Can I send you my two, maybe you can do something with them? LOL
Posts.Title: Some good news about my kids! LuAnnH ozzie2

Posts.Content: Times3 wrote: For me, the TM is a good indication of how well treatment is working.  When I found out that I had mets to my liver and before my first treatment of Abraxane and Avastin my TM count was over 1000.  Today I called the Onc to see what my last TM count was, this is after the 5th treatment, and my TM count was down to 181.9.  That was before my sixth (last treatment).  Needless to say, I am excited! I will have a PET scan next week and I really want to see what it looks like.  My nurse always lets me look at it after she gets done with the scan.  I am praying it is very little or better yet gone. My Onc doesn't want to say what kind of treatment we will do until after he gets the results of the scan. But I am happy to say that this Chemo worked well for me! Kendra Dx 12/2008, IDC, 1cm, Stage IV, Grade 2, 0/1 nodes, mets, ER+/PR+, HER2- Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Good New about TM today Times3 LisaSDCA

Posts.Content: Apr 3, 2009 12:18PM - edited Apr 3, 2009 12:21PM by Times3 I was on Abraxane/Avastin Combo and it worked really well for me.  The SEs that I had was hair loss, bloody nose, aches/pain for the first few days after chemo, but it wasn't too bad. I was on it every three weeks for 6 treatments.  I see my Onc next Friday to see how much it helped, but they have told me that the tumors have shrunk! Good luck and I hope it works well for you too! Edited to say it does cause Fatigue, but I think they all do.
Posts.Title: Not a good scan... pee bmdaley

Posts.Content: Mar 18, 2009 05:20AM Times3 wrote: That is wonderful news! I am so happy for you! I, too, have liver mets and love to know that this treatment has worked for you. I have a PET scan Friday now that I am finished with Abraxane/Avastin, maybe we can be NED together soon!
Posts.Title: MRI Results on Theraspheres TX RobinWendy sarika_for_mama

Posts.Content: Mar 17, 2009 12:05PM Times3 wrote: I just finished Abraxane and Avastin.  I only had minor leg pains for a couple of days after, but on my 4th treatment they gave me my Lupron shot, the combo had really bad SEs and I could barely get out of my recliner (slept in due to nausea). I did have to take a Neulasta shot with the chemo I received two years ago, and the pain with those shot made me feel like my bones would explode.  It could just be the combo you are on. You should probably ask your Onc what he can do to help. Sorry you are having such a hard time with the SE, I hope you find relief soon!
Posts.Title: Abraxane Pain EnergizerBunny saint
